continuum.solvers

Class EquilibriumSolverTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • test.EslimeTestCase
          • continuum.solvers.EquilibriumSolverTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCgsSolverTest

    public abstract class EquilibriumSolverTest
extends EslimeTestCase
    Tests that an equilibrium solver produces the expected answers to within machine epsilon.

      Make sure that complete decay without diffusion is the zero matrix.

      Make sure that respecifying an equilibrium sovler to I results in I.

      Make sure that respecifying an equilibrium solver to A results in the matrix I - A when A != I.

      • testBoundarySanity

        public void testBoundarySanity()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        The unit tests for the operators verify that the matrices are being built correctly, and the legacy tests verify that the output is consistent with previous results, which were verified to agree with analytical expectations (Borenstein, et al. 2013, PLOS ONE, figure S1 / eq. S5). This test verifies that some reasonable assumptions also hold for a different boundary conditions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
